title: Citi Argentina Introduces Credit Cards Targeted to Women
summary: Buenos Aires – Citi Argentina introduced the Citi MasterCard Women and Citi AAdvantage Black Mastercard credit cards, both featuring the American Airlines miles program. The cards are targeted to women.
tag-1: Citi Argentina Introduces Credit Cards Targeted to Women
tag-2: Buenos Aires – Citi Argentina introduced the Citi MasterCard Women and Citi AAdvantage Black Mastercard credit cards, both featuring the American Airlines miles program. The cards are targeted to women.
tag-3: These are not just new kinds of cards in the market, but feature a global rewards program that responds to the needs of many women, offering rewards that recognize multiple interests.
tag-4: Both cards offer group discounts and promotions in the traditional areas of fashion and beauty, with new categories that reflect women´s interests, especially affluent women.
tag-5: The cards offer benefits in entertainment – plays that might be of interest to women; books by female authors; promotions on travel and women-oriented destinations and restaurants. There are also discounts on car repair and car wash centers, electrician services and other services where cardholders will find discount prices and good customer service.
tag-6: Citi Argentina's Marketing Head Marcela Remoli said, "The new card is targeted to a growing segment of the population. At Citi, we are always ahead of relevant trends, so we have launched timely and specially-designed products for the contemporary women that reflect and improve their lifestyle."
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
